ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed essential skills in Spanish and important conversational skills.
Spanish, especially conversational Spanish in areas including environment/urban space and job interviews. Large focus on different tenses too.
Spanish language skills
I gained spanish speaking skills
Improved knowledge, fluency of Spanish
I learned more Spanish vocabulary and grammar. I also learned a lot about the culture of some Spanish-speaking countries.
My conversational Spanish and knowledge of Spanish tenses have greatly improved this semester
I learned how to speak Spanish in past tenses and how to speak in a few other tenses.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths are that the faculty are amazing, but it could be improved that the amount of material could decrease. It is a lot of material in a short period of time.

Strength is the large engagement of materials. Each class day is slightly different, using many mediums and different kinds of activities. I really appreciated this effort. I think the Spanish department makes a good effort to focus lessons on Spanish and Latin American culture too.
Weakness is how quickly the class moves; I wish there was more time for review. I ended up requesting a Spanish tutor, which ultimately was really useful and something I would recommend for any language learner at Yale.
It was a great course and cannot be improved

More vocab exercises in-class to help learn new words would be a major improvement. The cultural assignments provided a lot of interesting information but did not majorly contribute to language skill.

This course is really engaging and a great way to learn the language. I thought the environment for the class really fostered learning, but one weakness was that we were learning a lot of new vocabulary and tenses, but not having a ton of time to practice them in class with all of the in class projects. Youll need to put in a good amount of time to practice or its easy to fall behind
Strengths of this course include learning the content on our own and coming to class to ask questions or do activities with what we learned.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would, but I would tell them that there is a high workload.
Yes, to fulfill your language requirement
Yes it was a phenomenal course if you want to learn spanish
If you need to get language credits, probably not otherwise.
If you want to learn Spanish or get a language credit, this is a great class

If they are a student taking a stem or very intensive degree program I would not. This class was very difficult to balance with all of my other stem classes. Its almost as if were being expected to major in Spanish. The workload is a bit much. I did learn a lot but I some work just felt like busy work and I couldve learned just as much without doing it
